thread.title: Police: Drunk driver kills 4 after crashing into Okahoma State homecoming parade
thread.title_full: Police: Drunk driver kills 4 after crashing into Okahoma State homecoming parade

title: Police: Drunk driver kills 4 after crashing into Okahoma State homecoming parade
text:
Police: Drunk driver kills 4 after crashing into Okahoma State homecoming parade 
By Eric Dutkiewicz - 21Alive Credit: @geoff_eaton via ABC News Police: Drunk driver kills 4 after crashing into Okahoma State homecoming parade October 25, 2015 Updated Oct 25, 2015 at 11:37 AM EDT 
STILLWATER, Okla. (21Alive) – Four people were killed and 47 others were injured Saturday when police say a drunk woman crashed her car into the homecoming parade at Oklahoma State University. 
The Stillwater, Okla., Police Department says Adacia Chambers, 25, of Stillwater drove into a crowd of people watching the Sea of Orange parade at 11:30 a.m. EDT. 
Digital Daily – subscribe to our daily newsletter 
A 2-year-old child, a married couple and a 23-year-old woman all died of their injuries, police confirm. 
“Our hearts ache from the weight of the grief we feel,” Oklahoma State president V. Burns Hargis said in a statement. “The Oklahoma State University Homecoming parade is the most wholesome of events and to have it marred in such a way is incomprehensible.” 
Chambers was arrested on driving under the influence charges. She is scheduled to appear in court Monday.The university held a moment of silence prior to the kickoff of the Cowboys football game against Kansas.
